mods.abstract: The author argues evolution is only a theory, and one \at varience with the Holy Writ\

titleInfo.title: Of Monkeys and Men: Public and Private Views from the Scopes Trial

recordInfo.recordOrigin: Created and edited in general conformance to MODS Guidelines (Version 3.5).

location.physicalLocation: University of Tennessee, Knoxville. Special Collections

titleInfo.title: STATUS OF THE THEORY OF ORGANIC EVOLUTION

mods.note: Contains 4 typewritten pages, and extra handwritten notes on verso of 3rd typewritten page.
mods.accessCondition: The copyright interests in this item remain with the creator. For more information contact Special Collections at special@utk.edu.
mods.note: [Note: Handwritten on reverse of third page of manuscript]\n*1. The germinal constitution is a factor in every characteristic an organism has.2. Change in germinal constitution may [illegible] given Environment, alter any characteristic [Section torn]3. What the Environment can do is limited by what the germ contains. [but?]4) The Environment is a factor in every characteristic. 5. Change in Environment may alter any characteristic.6. What the germinal constitution can produce is strictly limited by the Environment under [which?] it develops.Some of the principles experimentally determined by Mendel by personal investigation in his flower garden, - of the Austrian Monastery of which he was abbot.I do not know whether Mendel claimed to have developed any new species, - [illegible].A.B.B.
